snippet: Their testimony is part of an investigation into a Kurdish separatist group and is the latest round in a power struggle between the country’s security forces and its intelligence agency.
abstract: Turkish intelligence agency chief Hakan Fidan and four of his former colleagues are compelled to testify in investigation into the Kurdish separatist group PKK, in latest round of a power struggle between country's security forces and its intelligence agency.
lead_paragraph: Their testimony is part of an investigation into a Kurdish separatist group and is the latest round in a power struggle between the country’s security forces and its intelligence agency.
